com.mishmash.rally

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mishmash.rally.Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Card>

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Card>
    Our basic item in a card game, and the building blocks of our hands. A card has a numeric value and a suit, and can verify that it is valid.
    Author:
    mrmcduff

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card()
        No-arg constructor for a card. Useful as a quick way to create a joker.

      • Card

        public Card(int value,
    Card.Suit suit)
        Standard constructor for a card.
        Parameters:
        value - Numeric value, which must be between 2 and 14, inclusive, to be valid.
        suit - The card's suit.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Getter for the numeric value of the card.
        Returns:
        The value field.

      • getSuit

        public Card.Suit getSuit()
        Getter for the suit of the card.
        Returns:
        The suit field.

      • setValue

        public boolean setValue(int value)
        Setter for the numeric value of the card. Defends against invalid values.
        Parameters:
        value - The new numeric value.
        Returns:
        True if the value was correctly set. Otherwise false.

      • setSuit

        public void setSuit(Card.Suit suit)
        Setter for the suit.
        Parameters:
        suit - The suit to set.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the card is valid. The seventeen of clubs, for instance is invalid. Any numeric value is valid for a joker.
        Returns:
        True if the card has a valid value-suit combination.

      • getValueString

        public java.lang.String getValueString()
        Gets a pretty-printable string for the value of the card.
        Returns:
        A printable string for the card's value.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Card other)
        Override for the compareTo method which will allow us to sort cards. Note that the suits have an order, all jokers are equal, and jokers are higher than all other cards.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Card>
        Parameters:
        other - The other card to which to compare this.
        Returns:
        A positive value if this is greater than other, negative if this is lesser, and zero if this.equals(other).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object that)
        Overriding the equals method.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        We overrode equals, so we have to override hashCode.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A toString override.
